alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 14 at 10:58AM CDT until June 14 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1058 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Elba, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Elba around 1115 AM CDT. Fort Rucker around 1145 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Mixons Crossroads, Carl Folsom A/p, Victoria, Frisco, Danleys Crossroads, Eanon, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Lee and Clintonville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
